description.label: Description
description.value: You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals. The spell doesn't make them more friendly than normal. Cunning animals are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.

items.name: Speak with Animals (at will; arthropods only)

description.label: Description
description.value: You fill the minds of your enemies with doubt. Targets that fail their Will saves take a -1 status penalty to attack rolls as long as they are in the area. Once per turn, starting the turn after you cast bane, you can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to increase the emanation's radius by 5 feet and force enemies in the area that weren't yet affected to attempt another saving throw. Bane can counteract bless.

description.label: Description
description.value:
The simplest magic does your bidding. You can perform simple magical effects for as long as you Sustain the Spell. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can choose one of four options.

  • Cook Cool, warm, or flavor 1 pound of nonliving material.
  • Lift Slowly lift an unattended object of light Bulk or less 1 foot off the ground.
  • Make Create a temporary object of negligible Bulk, made of congealed magical substance. The object looks crude and artificial and is extremely fragile-it can't be used as a tool, weapon, or spell component.
  • Tidy Color, clean, or soil an object of light Bulk or less. You can affect an object of 1 Bulk with 10 rounds of concentration, and a larger object a 1 minute per Bulk.

Prestidigitation can't deal damage or cause adverse conditions. Any actual change to an object (beyond what is noted above) persists only as long as you Sustain the Spell.
A mitflit's self-loathing makes it easy to influence. It takes a -4 penalty to its Will DC against checks to Coerce, Demoralize, Make an Impression, and Request.

Mitflits can use Diplomacy to Make an Impression on and Request things of arthropods (insects, spiders, scorpions, crabs, and similar invertebrate animals). Most arthropods have a starting attitude of indifferent to mitflits.

description.label: Description
description.value: This long, narrow tube is used for shooting blowgun darts, using only the power of a forcefully exhaled breath.

description.label: Description
description.value: These thin, light darts are typically made of hardwood and stabilized with fletching of down or fur. They are often hollow so they can be used to deliver poison.

description.label: Description
description.value:
These thin, light darts are typically made of hardwood and stabilized with fletching of down or fur. They are often hollow so they can be used to deliver poison.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Spear Frog Poison]{Spear Frog Poison}

description.label: Description
description.value: This threepronged, spearlike weapon typically has a 4foot shaft. Like a spear, it can be wielded with one hand or thrown.

As long as it isn't @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened}, a mitflit gains a [[/r +2 # status bonus to damage rolls against a creature that has previously damage]] status bonus to damage rolls against a creature that has previously damaged or tormented it.

A single spear frog yields enough toxin to Craft 1 dose of spear frog poison.

Saving Throw DC 15 Fortitude

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 1d4 #poison]] poison damage (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 1d4 #poison]] poison damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Enfeebled]{Enfeebled} 1 (1 round)
